00002 
00003 /* Time stamps -- implemented with total order maintenance data
00004    structure.  Each timestamp t holds one of three values:
00005 
00006    1) A (read) closure start-time.
00007    2) A (read) closure end-time.
00008    3) A write.
00009 */
00010 
00011 #ifndef __SLIME_TIMESTAMP_H__
00012 #define __SLIME_TIMESTAMP_H__
00013 #include <stdio.h>
00014 #include "totalorder.h"
00015 
00016 typedef to_node_t timestamp_t;
00017 
00018 typedef enum timestamp_tag_e {
00019   TIMESTAMP_CLOSURE_BEGIN = 0,
00020   TIMESTAMP_CLOSURE_END   = 1,
00021   TIMESTAMP_WRITE         = 2,
00022 } timestamp_tag_t;
00023 
00024 timestamp_t* timestamp_advance(timestamp_tag_t tag, void* data);
00025 int          timestamp_isleq(timestamp_t* time1, timestamp_t* time2);
00026 int          timestamp_isgt(timestamp_t* time1, timestamp_t* time2);
00027 void         timestamp_kill(timestamp_t* time, void* data);
00028 void         timestamp_killall(timestamp_t* start, timestamp_t* end);
00029 void         timestamp_printall(FILE* file);
00030 
00031 
00032 #endif
